Parabigeminal nucleus.CytoDefiningCriteria: A compact cell group that lies along the lateral margin of the mesopontine region just ventral to the brachium of the inferior colliculus.
ChemoDefiningCriteria: Majority of cells are cholinergic.  ChAT-positive cell bodies of the parabigeminal nucleus are oval in shape and 10-20/um in diameter
Parabigeminal nucleus.Definition: Cholinergic cell group that is located ventral to the brachium of the inferior colliculus (in rat) and has reciprocal connectivity with the superior colliculus (Adapted from Paxinos, The rat central nervous system, 2nd ed, 1995, pg 865
